doc.after: "Colonel Joe" soon began a new company, Mackey International Airlines. It was equipped with secondhand Convair 440[2] and Douglas DC-6 piston engine airliners. A Mackey International Air Commuter subsidiary operation was equipped with Beech 99 19-seat turboprop aircraft. In 1977, Mackey's headquarters located in Fort Lauderdale, Florida was the target of a bombing attributed to Cuban anti-Castro activity in the United States.[3][4] Mackey International Airlines ceased operations in 1981.[5]
